{"step_by_step_thinking": "The rubber dam is applied to the tooth and anchored into place using a metal or flexible plastic clamp. If the gingiva is seen protruding out of the margins, it could be due to the holes in the dam being placed too close together, causing the dam to pull on the gingiva. Edematous gingival tissues, using a light-weight dam, or holes placed too far apart would not cause the gingiva to protrude out of the margins.", "answer_choice": "D. Holes placed too close together"}
